div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 07:53 am CDT

div.span: Showers and thunderstorms likely, then showers and possibly a thunderstorm after 4pm. High near 66. Calm wind becoming south southeast 5 to 7 mph in the afternoon. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

Showers likely and possibly a thunderstorm before 10pm, then a slight chance of showers between 10pm and 1am. Cloudy, with a low around 47. North wind 9 to 11 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms after 1pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 67. North wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

div.p: We would like to wish Bev, Adrean, and Karlene a happy Administrative Assistant Day! Thanks for all that you do!

a.aria-label: Read more about Happy Administrative Assistant Day

div.p: The Nodaway-Holt Board of Education, Administration, and Staff continue to plan for our Senior graduation to be held on May 10 at 2:00 pm. We will do everything possible to abide by the current Governor orders and County ordinances and adjust our procedures if some of the orders are relaxed. We want to provide for a positive experience for all but we will still strive to keep everyone safe and will . . .

Starting this Friday, the Maryville Pizza Ranch will be hosting a Nodaway-Holt Community Impact Day that will run for 4 consecutive Fridays. During these Impact Days the Maryville Pizza Ranch will contribute 10% of net sales each Friday for both Delivery and Pickup.
Pizza Ranch will deliver to the old school location in Skidmore each Friday evening near 6pm. All orders need to be made with the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Pizza Ranch Supports Nodaway-Holt

div.p:
Nodaway-Holt School District will hold Regular session meeting via zoom. You may attend this meeting by following the links below.
Topic: April 15 Regular School Board Meeting Time: Apr 15, 2020 06:00 PM Central Time (US and Canada)
Join Zoom Meeting https://zoom.us/j/96715714809
Meeting ID: 967 1571 4809 One tap mobile +16465588656,,96715714809# US (New York) +13126266799,,96715714809# US . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about April Regular Board Meeting

div.p: During this time of uncertainty and ever-changing developments, it is up to district administration to make the difficult decisions that will impact student lives. Administration does not want students to lose out on opportunities, however it is our responsibility to ensure that our students, employees, and school stakeholders are, and will continue to remain, safe. For that reason, decisions have been made regarding the following . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about District Event Updates

div.p: The Nodaway-Holt School District will remain closed until further notice. Earlier today Nodaway County passed an ordinance 2020-1 in response to Covid 19 stating in section 4 schools shall remain closed until May 1. This Ordinance does not prohibit schools from providing child care and Food and Nutritional Services for those children that qualify. Teachers and staff may enter the building as long as they follow the directives of this . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about March 26 School Update

div.p:
Dear Nodaway-Holt Parents, Staff, and Students,
I would like to touch base with you regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19). I know this has brought a lot of stress, worry, and a lot of unknowns. As a district, we are actively monitoring this and continually gathering information from our local health departments, federal and state organizations. Reliable resources that you can refer to for updated . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Letter from Nurse Prettyman

div.p: The Nodaway-Holt School District will continue to provide breakfast and lunch for any student ages 18 and under. Our staff is serving at the High school in Graham, Elementary in Maitland, and Newton Hall in Skidmore. Serving time is from 9:00 am to noon. For your safety and ours we will be serving the grab and go meals "at the door". Each site will have limited access for our students and patrons. We also recommend to phone . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about School Lunch Procedures

div.p: The Covid 19 virus has affected each and every one of us in some form or another. It has changed our daily routines and the days ahead will be different for us all. The staff at Nodaway-Holt is committed to providing ongoing instruction and learning. Teachers will be working diligently to provide students with virtual and traditional instruction and exploring other opportunities for extended learning. Educational services will be . . .

a.aria-label: Event Date: May 8, 2020, Event Time: All Day, Event Title: Senior's Last Day

p.strong:
Nodaway-Holt R-VII
Foster Care Point of Contact (POC)
Foster Care Liaison

p.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.em: The Nodaway-Holt R-VII School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in its admission or access to, or treatment or employment in, its programs and activities. Any person having inquiries concerning the Nodaway-Holt R-VII School Districts' compliance with the laws and regulations implementing Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (Title VI), Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 (Title IX), The Age Discrimination in Employment Act (ADEA), Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (Section 504), or Titles II or III of the Americans with the Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA) is directed to the applicable Compliance Coordinator below who has been designated by the Nodaway-Holt R-VII School District to coordinate School District efforts to comply with the laws and regulations implementing Title VI, Title IX, the IDEA, Section 504, and the ADA. The Nodaway-Holt R-VII School District has established grievance procedures for persons unable to resolve problems arising under the statutes above. The Compliance Coordinator for the applicable law, whose name is listed below, will provide information regarding those procedures upon request. Any person who is unable to resolve a problem or grievance arising under the laws and regulations cited above may contact the Office of Civil Rights, Region VII, 8930 Ward Parkway, Suite 2037, Kansas City, MO 64114; phone (816) 268-0550. Our School District’s Compliance Coordinator is Dr. Jeff Blackford, Superintendent of Schools, 318 South Taylor Street, Graham, MO 64455, (660) 939-2137.
